heading: contributors
subheading: paul bennett (sadie@el.net) lives and writes from the lower east side. colin berry (colinb@sirius.com) pens short stories and covers the arts, music, and culture from san francisco. he is writing a book on internet addiction. paul boutin (paul@hotbot.com) is hotbot’s product manager for business development. jon caramanica (jon@tracemag.com) is editor at large of trace magazine. […]
author: wired staff
text: paul bennett (sadie@el.net) lives and writes from the lower east side.colin berry (colinb@sirius.com) pens short stories and covers the arts, music, and culture from san francisco. he is writing a book on internet addiction.paul boutin (paul@hotbot.com) is hotbot's product manager for business development.jon caramanica (jon@tracemag.com) is editor at large of trace magazine.chris charla is editor in chief of next generation magazine.phil hall is an okapi at the bronx zoo.jon kaufthal (kaufthal@ibm.net) freelances out of seattle, where he designs software by day.josh lucas (josh@stonecottage.com) tries to write as many words as he does lines of code in cambridge, massachusetts.scott martins lives in denver, where he works as an editor, freelance writer, and game designer.alanna nash is working on a book about colonel tom parker.tamara palmer (trance@netcom.com) is coeditor of urb and transmits to amazon.com, cdnow, and flaunt from the depths of san francisco.james rozzi (rozzi1625@aol.com) lives in atlanta, where he's a musician, a teacher, and a writer with a local jazz column.tony scherman's backbeat: earl palmer's story was recently published by smithsonian institution press.stephan somogyi's business card asserts that he's chief knowledge officer at the information-strategy firm method. in addition to writing for wired, he contributes frequently to the economist, and id.philip van vleck (pvv@bellsouth.net) covers pop music and theater for the durham herald-sun.got an idea for street cred? email street credcelebrating edificepop-up pixoriginal quirkceos get wiseyour assistant's assistantdilbert killerinternet on line onereadmemusicpower slidesay anything - anywherefood from thoughtunsung heroesjust outta betasaving private ivantrue dial-tone computingcontributors
